website_summaries.verdict: This top choice for catching creepy crawlies is also easy for kids to use.
pros: Simple to operate due to its basic design
Has an easy-on chamber cap to trap bugs inside
The short shaft on the vacuum makes it no problem for kids to work
cons: Some users complained that the suction power was not as strong as it should be, making it difficult to pick up larger bugs

customer_reviews.title: Wasp, stink bugs, spiders! Easy Removal
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and finally decided to purchase as there were stink bugs getting in through an a window a/c unit. They like to hang out in the curtains so it was a little tricky to suck them up as other people mentioned it is not super powerful. However if they are on a flat surface it's perfect. One night during a blizzard my cat was hunting something in the living room. It was a wasp! During the dead of winter. 😭 Panicked, I remember I had the bug buster and ran to get it. Sucked it up super easy off of the coffee table leg. I left it die a slow painful death in the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: change in rating
customer_reviews.text: This was the best vacuum for bugs we'd ever found...the first one lasted about 5 years so we bought a couple more... something changed...the new one(s) do not work properly...any of the three...One low grade vacuum...can't lift the bugs, Two fell apart...Three sometimes works great and then....nada sigh...buying another brand...Sorry
customer_reviews.author: Don Lj Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Love my bugbuster!
customer_reviews.text: I love my bugbuster! I use it all the time, even for the big spiders that occasionally appear in my basement. It is much easier for me to use this wonderful tool rather than trying to step on or otherwise kill an insect. And, I bought more than one to store in different areas of my home! As much as I don’t particularly like spiders, I really don’t like to kill anything! These little critters just need to be put outside where they are intended to be!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR DADDY-LONG-LEGS
customer_reviews.text: We have the Bazooka spider catcher, which is terrific for denser pests, but terrible for daddy-long-legs; they are so fragile, it mangles and destroys them. This product is PERFECT FOR THEM. Others complain that it is not powerful enough, and for denser bugs this may be true; however, for daddy-long-legs, it is the ideal strength. It gently draws them in to the compartment--I keep the vacuum on until I put the cap back on--then I put the cap on, take them outside, take off the cap and they tumble right out of the compartment--COMPLETELY UNHARMED. It is effortless, gentle, and humane. A wonderful product. The ONLY product we know of that works for this specific need.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Kalli

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I put a brand new 9V battery in it and followed the instructions to put it about an inch from the target bug and turn it on and it would suck up the bug. In this case the little bug just walked away. I grabbed the bug and put it in the tube and turned it on and the bug walked up the tube with no problem. Bottom line is that this bug vacuum couldn't suck up an ant if the ant was already crawling half way up the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Brad G.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases we've ever made.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this; we have two ourselves now, and whenever we have a friend moving into a new home, we grab one as a housewarming gift for them. Easy to suck bugs out and fling them out the door/window, without having to hurt them or herd them onto a piece of paper. The suction isn't always great, but if you start trying to scoop the bug up with it, it'll go in every time. I've even caught HOUSEFLIES with the thing. Would buy 30 more.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Our last bug sucker gave up the ghost and it’s no longer available, so I took a chance on this despite the bad reviews. Save your money this thing would be lucky to such up a ladybug! PROs: It has a cap for the tube to keep the bug from escaping. It has a screen to keep the bug out of the fan. CONs: It won’t suck up a bug if your life depended on it!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even work for the bugs on the box.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has TERRIBLE suction. I understand the point is so that it doesn't to hurt the bugs, but there's a big difference between not hurting them and not even pulling them into the tube at all. The stupid stinkbugs we get -- which are on the front of the box! as in yes this machine is made to capture those! -- are so heavy that this doesn't vacuum them up AT ALL. And they're not even that big. This was a total waste of money and I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: lenthatswho

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this it is a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It was too difficult to put together so still sits in the box. Real cheap don't buy it. Just suck bugs up with the vacuum cleaner,
customer_reviews.author: raine lea

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this gadget to use prior to gardening to prevent spiders on my head. Florida has many. Easy to assemble an use. Could use a little more suction power to actually separate spider from or perhaps a sharper edge to be able to cut through web. You have to twirl it around a bit to break spider lose and get it to suction into tube at risk of spider getting lose. Over all I enjoyed using it and got 9 spiders away from my yard first try and not one got near me. thanks it’s a great product but see I’d you can make it a bit more powerful!
customer_reviews.author: Liberty M Iturralde

customer_reviews.title: No suction! Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because there are some positive reviews that say the product works. Well buyer beware this thing is a hunk of junk. It is completely incapable of sucking up any size insect or arachnid. You can hold the device at whatever angle you want and it makes no difference. Steer clear of this one folks it's not worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This bug vacuum works really good. Great suction! Only problem is the tube is really short and my roommate who actually gets my bugs away from me is 5 foot 5 and can’t reach the ceiling with this. We took the tube from my old vacuum and put it on this one and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey L. Engel

customer_reviews.title: Evicting unwanted house guests
customer_reviews.text: I had a spider infestation. Daddy long leg type. After waiting patiently for my Bugbuster to arrive I set to work evicting those little and not so little guys. The webs inhibited the process of sucking them up a little because they are sticky but it still got the job done. I made at least 12 trips outside to send them on their merry way. They all came out unharmed and scampered off. I'm not sure if it will work on the big huntsman spiders that occasionally make their way in, (think 2 inch leg span and somewhat heavy), but hopefully I won't have to find out. For smaller spiders it works wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Bman's mom

customer_reviews.title: I love this bug picker upper
customer_reviews.text: I love this bug picker upper. If you want to catch a fly it needs to be on the window then vacuum away. Lady bugs, make sure they are on the floor place the vacuum over the bug it will suck it right up. I love being able to release the catch outside where the insects need to be. If you are having suction problems replace the battery. I have one in my camper and 2 in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gee, not too good.
customer_reviews.text: Let me not rant. Inserting a 9 v battery easy enough, now try to line up the battery door, ah -- not so easy, fumbling, cheap plastic. Okay it's working. Sucked up several yellow jacket bees, mosquitoes. Now they're flying around inside the tube which has been capped. This is not a trap and release option. If I open the door to capture additional pests, the ones inside the tube start escaping and now they're angry. Actually a little funny, what else to do? I could not spray bug spray into the tube as it would be also be drawn into the suction filter and possibly clogging this.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee

customer_reviews.title: works ok for average insects
customer_reviews.text: although weak, as all the other brands I tried, it is useful for some insects. Like smaller spiders (the big spiders with thick legs are not impressed) and other small crawling insects. Surprisingly, it worked sometimes for cockroaches, but often they are very quick. I do not understand why they don't make the bugbusters with a stronger vacuum power, would be willing to pay more for that, but maybe that could injure fragile insects? I do like the fact that you don't kill an insect while moving it outside the house.
customer_reviews.author: sunny

customer_reviews.title: Nice little invention
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing a friend use one. She bought it for "stink bugs". They seem to be everywhere. Instead of using tissue paper, and getting that smell on you, this little product works very well. Just put it up to the bug while turned on , and it sucks it into the tube, at which point you put the cap over the opening , turn it off, then take it to the toilet to flush. The reason i gave it a 4 star was that is has a small suction motor. This can be expected as it is a small tool , and at the price, is good. What was i expecting , Dyson....Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T.

customer_reviews.title: POS. Returning it.
customer_reviews.text: This POS was DOA. Cost me a trip to the hardware store to ensure it wasn't an issue with the 9-volt battery that they didn't bother to include, but it ran weakly for three seconds before it spun down. Best use of this would be to snack spiders with it. Instead I'm returning it to get the money back.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Reinecke

customer_reviews.title: A Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Bug Buster only for getting rid of Cellar Spiders. After reading some of the reviews I had doubts that I was going to be able to extract the Cellar Spiders out of the thick messy webs that they create. But, no problem. Was able to catch different sizes, sometimes with parts of the web, and release outside. The only problem I had was that a couple were too fast for me, and took off to hide.
customer_reviews.author: LarryC

customer_reviews.title: This thing will only suck a bug if you turn it on and put ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing will only suck a bug if you turn it on and put it directly over the bug. I do not recommend anyone to buy this product. It doesn't suck. It is a piece of junk and a total wast of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It will suck in mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.text: We live in mosquite-infested Florida, and deal with them most of the year! We own 3 now, one for each car, and one for our house. The first one got a short in the wiring, as the battery fell out. Tape around the cap keeps it on. It is impossible to reach the wiring to soldier it back together. I used an essential oil on a piece of paper towel, stuck inside the tube, to anesthetize the mosquitoes - permanently.
customer_reviews.author: Flutterby

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: Suction is low, sucked up stink bugs and ladybugs 50% of the time. Not strong enough to chase doen a fly. Still useful to get them on the end of it and throw them out the window but could've used any long object. I'd love a reverse feature to blow the bug out when you get outside lol.
customer_reviews.author: smcomeau

customer_reviews.title: bugbuster-NOT!
customer_reviews.text: I had an original bugbuster for 10 years and it worked fine until it stopped working, as expected for something that old. This NEW bugbuster hasn't enough suction to lift a piece of dust let alone a fly. The flys laughed at it as they flew away. Sorry to say that my wife and I are really disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: For our friends the spiders
customer_reviews.text: Very grateful for this vacuum! I can't kill things as a general rule, but I'm in an end unit that is full of spiders. This thing is a god-send. I use it almost daily. It doesn't suck well into corners, but as long as the bug is on a flat surface it does really well.
customer_reviews.author: sonicfan

customer_reviews.title: very low power
customer_reviews.text: This device was not able to suck a leaf foot nymph from a tomato, that's a pretty tiny bug. I believe it might be able to suck up a gnat if you have it trapped against a flat surface and hold the tube right up to it. Otherwise, don't waste your money, terribly under-powered and absolutely useless for gardeners.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you live with spiders.
customer_reviews.text: Omg I had a big spider problem in my new place so bought one of these immediately. It works great. Except for this one giant spider, that one took a while to suck up. So I’ll give him a pass. All the others are easy to take down. The only problem is not always having this on hand everywhere you need to to be when encountering a spider. I keep it in my basement.
customer_reviews.author: StrawberryBell

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to buy this and be able to get rid of insects that make it inside but it literally has no suction whatsoever. I went and bought brand new batteries for it, so I don't what else it could be except it's just a terrible product. I honestly don't see what other purpose this could have without suction so it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Thea M.

customer_reviews.title: No Suction Whatsoever!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about getting this product, but alas, I was deeply disappointed. I tried 3 different batteries thinking that might be the problem , but not even the tiniest bug/spider got sucked into the tube chamber! If you're trying to capture a bug on the floor, forget it! And if you want to get one off the wall or ceiling, the best you could hope for is that the insect falls into the tube! A total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: I will not be without one anymore.
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly like it says. My home in Florida is pretty buggy. I don't like to use poison inside the house, and I don't like killing things. This amazing device has removed every bug I've attempted without damaging them and without me having to touch them. It's especially good at spiders, but works on flying insects too. I even removed a Palmetto bug with it, although it got me a little closer to to it than I wanted to be, it worked! I wish I could give this 10 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Barrineau

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I used to try to grab a cup to catch bugs and take them outside. It was difficult and they escaped. This bug catcher is one of the best things I ever bought. I put the tube over it,it crawls in, I put the cap on. Easy and effective. I would only change the size of the tube and the vacuum power.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Insects mock this device
customer_reviews.text: While I believe the concept of this device is sound the actual operation of it is severely lacking. The suction power on this is terrible. It has not been able to suck up one insect I have used it on including small spiders, stink bugs, flies, and thousand-leggers. If you need something that you wave in the general direction of an insect, like a wand of anti-insect removal, making an irritating noise that makes them run away, than this is the device for you! Hopefully the battery lasts long enough to chase the bug over to your neighbor's house because that is the only way this thing is getting rid of anything other than clubbing them to death with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Bugs crawl in and bugs crawl out
customer_reviews.text: Tried sucking up some ants. Would not suck one in. In fact an ant walked in and back out again....I'd say this thing "sucks" ( at least as a product ) but actual sucking, barely holds a piece of paper .
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Catches stink bugs without the stink
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well. I was not happy that it required a 9v battery as those are the only ones I don’t keep on hand. Plus they don’t last long. But it does catch stink bugs even though they hang on. Not a lot of suction but enough to do the job. And no stink. I wish there was a stronger one on the market but have not found. 4 stars as it does what it says it does. It’s cheap enough not to care.
customer_reviews.author: Bentley R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a Buddhist Meditation Center we do not believe in killing. That means from the smallest insect up. We get over run with ants and such this was a humane way of catch and release outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stink Bug Catcher
customer_reviews.text: We own several of these and find them invaluable during this Stink Bug Invasion. Every morning my routine is to suchk'em up and dump them in water and watch in glee as they die. Call me evil? I think not. Stink Bugs are invading our lives and, as the name implies....they STINK. Thank you Sonic Technology for this tool. Just wish you had more extension tubes for my 10' ceilings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No suction; could not even pick up a tiny spider
customer_reviews.text: We tried this on two spiders. It makes a lot of noise but would not suck either one up. One was a tiny little spider, smaller than a pinky nail. The other was a juvenile black widow who just sat on the doorframe in the circle of the vacuum until we lifted it and then she crawled away unbothered. I've returned the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia R. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Great for All Bugs!
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these "bug suckers" for years and I love it! It reaches further for you, your hands aren't near the target and it doesn't hurt the bug / spider / whatever. It's nice for those ugly "stink bugs" that if you do squish them, they smell soo bad! You can suck them up and release them outdoors (or take them outside to squish). My friends saw it so I ended up buying a bunch and handing them out. They all love 'em! And Ladies- you don't have to call your guy to come get the spider! D
customer_reviews.author: Ledhed

customer_reviews.title: Works great for getting bugs out of the house
customer_reviews.text: If you're not interested in scraping bug guts off your ceiling, this is a great product. You can easily catch them and release outside (you get karma points too). I like that it's not rechargeable - it takes a 9v battery - so it's not running out of power all the time like the last one I had. It has good suction and is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: photogirltr6

customer_reviews.title: easy to grab spiders and release them outside
customer_reviews.text: I now use this all the time for bug catching and taking them outside. I used to use a clear box with a piece of cardboard, but this is actually easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L. Shelton

customer_reviews.title: A TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.text: This device is a toy! It does not work as advertised. Right on the box it say is will "Suck up stink bugs" No way! You could hold it on the bug for hours and it wouldn't deliver as promised. Totally not powerful enough even with a brand new battery. A total disappointment!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Steffen

customer_reviews.title: Works great and doesn't hurt the spider
customer_reviews.text: We live in the country and spiders like our house. Since they eat bugs we like them but prefer if they stayed outside. My wife uses this and it really works great. I think she must use this 1-2 times a week. She sucks it up and releases the spider outside where they belong
customer_reviews.author: Robin M. Eales

customer_reviews.title: Be gentle handling it
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just handle with CARE. Broke after 3 uses. Flimsy and brittle. Internal wire pulled free. UN-Repairable .
customer_reviews.author: Brad D.

customer_reviews.title: Very East to Use
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I purchased it after seeing one of my friends using it. I'm not too fond of getting close to the big bugs that find out way into the house and this makes it easy! Not to mention, you don't have to kill the bugs! You can release them outside :)
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: is great. My daughters LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: Since I've had a similar gadget before, my expectations were that this would have similar effectiveness. I was wrong. The Bug Buster is just too weak to pick up any bug that is large, or that moves much. (Those are the most challenging). The bug's "momentum" outruns the strength of the vacuum. I'd give it a one star but it does, technically, work. The concept of catching bugs without having to touch or kill them, is great. My daughters love the idea of it & we had a similar gadget in the past, that worked better. I know there are better "bug suckers" out there, but this one is just too weak. We need something that is stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Spitfire8

customer_reviews.title: know the products limitations
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for one that we had for many years and used all the the time. this is better as they have improved the on/0ff switch.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: Deadly to stink bugs
customer_reviews.text: Does what I needed it to do. Captures those fall invading bugs and releases outside without harm, besides maybe a bit of emotional scarring, but I can't be certain. Long attachment makes it easy to get 'em off the ceiling and just enough suction to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: mwgreen

customer_reviews.title: This BugBuster is the best for catching all bugs
customer_reviews.text: This BugBuster is the best for catching all bugs. Bees, wasps, lady bugs, turn switch on and what ever kind of bug is sucked right in. Put cap on and walk out side let bug go. I try to throw bug out, and I broke clear round plastic tube, so when you get the BugBuster, get a piece of tape and use it to tape tube to the yellow part. With BugBuster, you will never get a bee sting or bug bite.
customer_reviews.author: Dave W Pace

customer_reviews.title: This Works without hurting the bugs!’
customer_reviews.text: Love this so much I bought one for my daughter as well. I love being able to remove spiders, flies, and other bugs from my RV without harming them. It’s a simple yet effective tool for that. Don’t hesitate to purchase this for a gift, especially for a vegan friend
customer_reviews.author: Freedom

customer_reviews.title: Great Insect Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Most insects are pests and you don't mind killing them. But some insects and spiders eat other insects and if they get into your house this device makes it easy to save them and put them outside where they can eat more harmful insects. Works just like advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Carl in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t work. I got it for my daughter who is afraid of spiders. There’s not enough suction at all, Even when I put it directly over a spider.I got it as a Xmas gift so it was too late to return. Just wasted plastic now
customer_reviews.author: I. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: I got this to keep in the car. Mosquitoes are a big problem here. It works great to suck up the nasty little blood suckers. The downside is that you have to plug it up so they don’t get out. It would be nice if it had a little flap to keep the bugs inside instead of having to quickly plug it up.
customer_reviews.author: Christy D

customer_reviews.title: Every home should have one!
customer_reviews.text: Got a bug or spider you want to relocate to the outside? This is the insect friendly tool! If you don't like squishing and instead want the tiny life to carry on only not in your house, use this. You'll love it. Plus, for bug phobes, you can still stay a little distance away while sucking him up effortlessly in to the little vacuum.. then go outside and cast it away. We give the Bugbuster as gifts to our family and friends, after all, we all have homes that insects, etc. want to set up home in our space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works, but wimpy suction.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to suck up the flies that go to my windows when the sun is hot. If I can put the end of the suction tube directly on the fly, it will collect it, but the level of suction power is disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Bre L.

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: In an attempt for this item to protects the bug the suction is almost non existent. It couldn't pick up a fly on a pane of glass. I returned it for a refund as I felt the power of the unit was grossly misrepresented.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: It works okay, but should have a bit more suction to it.
customer_reviews.text: This catches bugs, but really doesn't have much suction power. We have our doors and windows open a lot, with no screens anywhere. We live in an area that doesn't have too many flying insects. We use this Bugbuster to get the slow-moving flies out of the kitchen, once they're tired of beating themselves up against the big windows. We have caught a spider or two. This is a great tool for repatriating insects/spiders to the great outdoors, but I used to have one that had a bit more suction. Thank you everyone, for being kind to insects and spiders. As one commenter wrote: It seems like the right thing to do.
customer_reviews.author: @your6Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly. It catches the big flies that are hard to kill and the fragile moths without harming them. The vacuum is so mild that it doesn't feel like it will do anything, but it's strong enough to catch a daddy long legs without hurting it.
customer_reviews.author: H J

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: I'd say that this thing sucks, but it doesn't, and that's the problem. It has barely any suction at all. I was trying to suck up a centipede, and the centipede crawled up to the mouth of the vacuum, felt it with it's antennae, and then crawled away effortlessly like it just decided not to be vacuumed. And for all it's lack of suction, it makes a ton of noise. Well, I can at least use it to 'scoop' up insects and toss them outside. Not completely useless. Two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Stinkbugs laugh at this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Even with brand-new, high-quality batteries I had to literally put the tube on top of the bug and then slide it to the side to knock it inside. Might work for tiny insects, but a waste of money for stinkbugs.
customer_reviews.author: NewMoonRising

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a cheaper product.
customer_reviews.text: Second one I bought. Love this thing. With it had more suction. Does work. Flies don’t seem to be able to see the clear base coming toward them. Does what I need it to do/environmentally friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: When this arrived and I put the battery in, I switched it on and expected a huge suction and it merely moved. I was prepared to write it off. BUT when I tried it worked perfectly on stings, spiders, wasps and flies. Obviously the suction is designed to be just enough toward without scaring insect away. Bought 2 more for other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I won't kill bugs or spiders, and this works perfectly to gently suck them up and put them outside. I use it several times a week. I gave one as a gift to a friend, and she loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: SueCal

customer_reviews.title: Unusually disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I thought this had a much larger hose, and the sucking hose part is only about a foot long. I thought it would be great for the kids, and my aging short mother-neither will get close to a spider, and this is too short to help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if stronger
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, the design is fine but I find it very underpowered. Even with fresh batteries it sometimes struggles with ladybugs. But for the price, expectations have to be real.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Buonomo

customer_reviews.title: A must have in my home.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one in twenty years. The old one broke and was replaced immediately. I use it inside the house for spiders, etc. Keep the 9V battery fairly fresh and you will love it too.
customer_reviews.author: kim d

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy to relocate the creepy crawlers outside-much better than squashing ...
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised, but I think having stronger suction and a longer tube to reach the high climbers would earn it five stars. I'm happy to relocate the creepy crawlers outside-much better than squashing them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Penny

customer_reviews.title: This device sucks... and not bugs.
customer_reviews.text: No real suction. It's a novel idea but it fails to be anything useful.
customer_reviews.author: Honest feedback from an honest guy

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t able to get it running after trying several new batteries. Had to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: It works great you have to get close to the bug
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Lee

customer_reviews.title: A great product for us fearful women!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cousin. It was very similar to my own, which I can't live without! I helped her put it together and sent her home to wait for her next spider or stinkbug.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Harsh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even suck up lint
customer_reviews.text: If you like the challenge of a stink bug fighting this vacuum and winning, this is the sucker for you. Otherwise, don't wast your money.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Someone else’s return
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was so poor I didn’t even open it. It was taped up like it had already been returned at least once, and the package was all beat up. Returned it immediately. It’s too bad, I was hoping to give it to an arachnophobia friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Sucks...but not in the good way :(
customer_reviews.text: This is perhaps the worst product I've ever purchased in my life! I tried several new batteries just to be certain, but not only would it not draw any air up to vacuum, it actually seemed to blow air. The stink bug I tried to catch just laughed at me. I tried vacuuming up non-moving insects just to be sure, but not one even budged! Sent back for a refund!!
customer_reviews.author: April Lane

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Didnt have the power to vacume a tiny, and i mean tiny, spider. Cant return since i missed my return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I love this device! I’m not a fan of creepy crawlers at all, nor do i enjoy getting close enough to kill them. I was so happy my husband purchased this for me since I’m a scaredy cat. I come across spiders but mostly crickets where i live and it has helped me capture them and release them outside where they belong! I’ve recommended this to friends/family also.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Edmonson

customer_reviews.title: Super for all bugs. We use them for crickets galore!
customer_reviews.text: Heh, I thought this was just going to be a little cute toy for an occasional spider but we have a cricket infestation. I have yet to experience a night without hubby vacuuming up with this a few crickets and dumping them live outdoors! Way more desirable than stepping on them and also easier since it is strong enough to such them up without perfect aiming. Who would have thought that this is THE perfect solution for getting crickets out of the house? Terrific!
customer_reviews.author: Angela A Stanton, PhD

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed in my purchase
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t have very much suction. I was very disappointed in my purchase. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Debbi Bussell

customer_reviews.title: grand kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: The grand kids love sucking up spiders and other critters and getting a close look at them. When they go home there isn't a bug within 100 yards of the house.
customer_reviews.author: s. breacain

customer_reviews.title: Not enough suction for any insect
customer_reviews.text: Not enough suction for any insect. Waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Chezron

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Works well to suck up gnats. Incredibly stupid idea to power this with a nine volt. Power hungry machine uses up the battery very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: mark marchand

customer_reviews.title: Effective spider control
customer_reviews.text: ACK! The 'cold snap' brought in a quarter sized spider every day so far! I gently vacuumed them up and took them outside. The system works perfectly! I am ordering another one for the perfect gift - for my family and the spiders!
customer_reviews.author: Gail L. Lanning

customer_reviews.title: Don't get it!
customer_reviews.text: This product is rather useless. It couldn't even suck up a piece of lint. A joke and should be taken off the market!
customer_reviews.author: Julie B. Peet

customer_reviews.title: Good for sucking up stink bugs keepin trapped
customer_reviews.text: Had one before broke but not from use from grandson who thought was a sword! Happy found another! Love the cap! Keeps bugs in!! Works great for stink bugs! Shorter tube but hey it’s fine!!love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's meh. Weak vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it one more star, but the motor is weak and the tube is only a foot long, so you have to bend over and get close for the bugs on the floor. I'm pretty sure that the spiders we have would not fit into the 1" tube -even if the "vacuum" were strong enough to pull it up into it.
customer_reviews.author: H.D.A. 4691

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Suction could be better. Tube needs to be longer. Manufacturer needs to do the right thing and correct these two issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ammayaya

customer_reviews.title: Save the bugs
customer_reviews.text: Very cool thought to save and not kill our bugs. Could be a little stronger, seems hard to suck up the bugs as they grab for thier lives on the surface where they are being sucked from.
customer_reviews.author: Jayden

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even bother!
customer_reviews.text: This product couldn’t even suck a small ant off my deck or a wispy spider out of a web- I was hoping to use it on some wasps in my entryway but was not even going to attempt after that! Returned it
customer_reviews.author: cf

customer_reviews.title: Virtually no suction......
customer_reviews.text: A great disappointment and a waste of money. I used to have one with a longer wand and it was much much better than this item.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: not a lot of suction
customer_reviews.text: needs a little more power to be very effective - does work tho
customer_reviews.author: mary swecker

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this originally because I was getting overwhelmed with those large carpenter ants. I wanted something that would suck up bugs but not kill them. Holy cow I am beyond impressed! I use it for spiders, sting bugs, ants etc. I have already been recommending it to everyone ha hope this helps you decide if it is useful because I wasn’t sure how it would work! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Snizzer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This Sonic Technology Bugbuster Spider and Insect Vacuum is not worth the plastic it is made of. It barely sucks air. I brought it for stink bugs on my balcony and for spiders on my boat. It's a real joke. I wish it was heavier, so I could use it for ballast to sick junk to the bottom of the ocean. But alas, it would float and some unsuspecting sailor might retrieve it, assuming it's a good product, and too would be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SubVet608

customer_reviews.title: Sending it back
customer_reviews.text: The suction power wasn't strong enough to get fruit flies, which is why we bought it. The motor is also very loud. It was a disappointment all around. I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jackiemacgirvin

customer_reviews.title: Okay product. Battery killer.
customer_reviews.text: It’s an okay little vacuum that does it’s job well enough. The main downside is that the battery will often need replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Decimos Zalaoras

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: The stinkbugs sure love to be high up on the curtains, out of reach. This mini vac is great for getting them.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Nothing
customer_reviews.text: This is valuable when catching a bug in the house. I can then take the bug outside and release him, completely unharmed.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Mae Ross

customer_reviews.title: It really does suck the most stubborn of bugs
customer_reviews.text: It really does suck the most stubborn of bugs. I have one at home that was given to me as a gift. And I bought one for an employee who has a fear of spiders. She LOVES it!
customer_reviews.author: Ann W.

customer_reviews.title: Useful and fun
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife as she hates bugs - she loves it - she can get the bug with no problem - kind of a game for her - her against the bugs in the house. Wish we had got it sooner !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Rhoden

customer_reviews.title: STINK BUGS BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Still using this after getting one as a gift. Bought 5 more for Christmas presents!! Everyone loves them, especially for using to trap-and-release spiders to garden. But my favorite use is for stink bugs. EW. No smell from smashing them! I throw them outside when it's frigid enough weather to kill them or put them in vinegar/baking soda water. Done. I wait til there are a number of dead ones, then throw them outside. (I do not waste a flush on single invaders) You can also just let them starve to death, nyah-ah-ah! In the summer I put the whole wand in the hot sun and let them suffocate in there. Sick. of. stink bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Holly B

customer_reviews.title: Humane bug relocater
customer_reviews.text: Great, humane and safe way to relocate bugs from inside the home to the outside. Bugs want to live just like we humans do. This handy bug wand allows us to treat bugs with love and compassion by gently moving them to a safer place.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy B.

customer_reviews.title: No more germy fly splatters in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Not strong enough to capture flies in mid-air, but worked well once I figured out the technique. Sneak up on a fly that's landed; then just lower the tube slowly from directly above the fly. Once you have him trapped, THEN turn on the suction. This keeps him in the tube while you place the cap or your hand over the end of the tube. (I found that turning on the suction before I had him trapped just scared him away.) Release outdoors with instructions to go pester noisy neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Another reviewer said the vacuum wasn't that ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Another reviewer said the vacuum wasn't that strong, but for me it still does the job without killing the bug. Just simply suck the bug up, put the cap on and go outside and release it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Sonic Technology Bugbuster, Battery Operated No Harm Spider and Insect Vacuum
product_meta.description: The BugBuster No-Harm VERY GENTLE Vacuum is a gentle no harm insect vacuum that sucks up bugs, insects, spiders, flies, stinging insects, bees and more. The Bugbuster cannot suck insects out of the air however works gently against a window, wall or floor. Wait for the insect to settle, then press the button to start the motor while carefully approaching the bug. When close enough, carefully hold the tube over the insect to gently suck it into the catch tube. While the motor is on, turn the BugBuster upright so the open end is pointing upwards preventing the insect from crawling out. Replace the cap at the end of the tube. Then take the insect outside and safely release at arm's length. This is a GENTLE insect vacuum designed not to harm the insect. Non-toxic, no harm insect control. Includes safety cap to prevent escape of stinging insects for safe removal. Operates on one 9 volt battery (Not Included). Must Use a DURACELL or ENERGIZER Battery for roper suction. Please make sure the tube is completely pushed down flush to the motor housing for GENTLE suction. Will not suck an insect out of the air.
feature_bullets: Use with one 9 Volt DURACELL or ENERGIZER Battery (Not Included)
Go Green! Safe Non-Toxic Insect Removal With Gentle Battery Operated BugBuster
Gently and Safely Sucks Up Small Bugs, Insects etc.
Great science fun and stocking stuffer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars804 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
